conversation.message: Dear School_D Admissions, I’m Student_E and I’m very interested in joining School_D. Your program is one of my top choices, and I would be excited to commit if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind Student_B, Student_C, Student_D). Those students also rank School_C highly (B has it 3rd, C has it 2nd, D has it 2nd), so competition is strong and an early application is likely to be rejected. My 2nd choice School_D ranks me 4th as well, but crucially the higher-priority students at School_D (Student_D and Student_A) both rank School_D last, and Student_C ranks it 3rd. That makes School_D a much more realistic path to a high-preference match for me. Therefore I should apply to School_D immediately to try to lock it in before others pivot there.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_D. We are pleased to offer you admission.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_E is on our true priority list (4th of 5), so acceptable. However, we have quota 1 and our top choices are Student_D and Student_A (then Student_C). Given students' preferences, Student_D ranks School_D last and Student_A ranks School_D last, so they are unlikely to apply here early (or at all). Student_C ranks School_D 3rd and may apply later, but is not guaranteed. Student_E ranks School_D 2nd and has already applied in round 1, making them a strong, likely-to-match candidate. Accepting now secures a filled seat with an acceptable student and avoids the risk of ending unmatched while waiting for higher-priority students who may never apply.

conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions committee—I'm Student_B. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the academic environment and opportunities to grow there. I would like to formally apply and be considered for your available seat. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but I have low priority there (4th), so an early application is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. I am top priority at School_C, which is my 3rd choice, so applying there now gives a strong chance to secure a high-ranked match rather than risk ending up much lower later. Therefore I will apply to School_C immediately.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application to School_C. We are pleased to offer you admission and would be excited to have you join our community.

Please confirm your acceptance so we can finalize your enrollment.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_B is #1 on School_C's true priority list. They have applied in round 1 and we have quota 1. Accepting immediately secures our top-choice match and avoids the risk of losing them to another school (Student_B ranks School_A and School_B above School_C). No other inbox messages this round to consider. Therefore, accept.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_C and I’m applying because School_B is my first choice. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would commit to enrolling if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. Given full information, School_B’s priority order is Student_E > Student_B > Student_C > Student_D > Student_A, so I am ranked 3rd. Student_A and Student_D also rank School_B first, and Student_B ranks it second, so competition is high. However, applying immediately is best because if Student_E applies to School_B I will likely be rejected anyway; if Student_E goes elsewhere, applying early gives me a chance to secure my top option before the seat is taken. I will send a strong, direct application emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for applying to School_B and for sharing that we are your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission and are happy to have your commitment to enroll.

[ACTION: ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received applications from C, D, and A. Among these, Student_C is the highest-ranked on my list. I have quota 1 and an acceptance creates an immediate match, removing me from further negotiation; however, holding out for Student_E or Student_B is risky because neither has contacted me yet and they may prefer/secure other schools (Student_B ranks School_A first; Student_E ranks School_B last). Given the current inbox, accepting Student_C maximizes my outcome among available applicants and avoids the risk of ending unmatched.

conversation.message: School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to enroll and would commit immediately if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. However, School_B’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_B, Student_C). Still, applying now gives me the only chance to secure my top option before it fills, and I can pivot to School_C next round if rejected.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_B is your first choice. At this time, we have already filled our available seat, so we’re unable to offer you admission.

We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the very best with your remaining applications.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions

[ACTION: REJECT]
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (Remaining Quota: 0) due to an established match with Student_C from prior acceptance. Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY] regardless of Student_D’s position on our true priority list. Student_D is ranked below Student_C on School_B’s priority list anyway, so even absent the hard constraint we would not switch. Therefore respond with a polite rejection and note capacity is full.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_A and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and would fully commit if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Even though School_B ranks me last in its priority list, waiting only increases the chance the seat is taken by higher-priority students who also like School_B. An early, direct application is my best shot; if rejected, I can move to School_C next round.

Even though Student_A is on our true priority list, we cannot accept without capacity; Student_A is also lowest on our priority list, and we already hold a higher-ranked match than Student_A. Therefore we must reject.

However, E (our top choice) has not contacted us; E ranks School_A third (after C, D) so may not apply soon or at all. Holding out risks ending unmatched or settling for lower priority later. Accepting D now secures our second-best choice and blocks uncertainty. Therefore accept Student_D.
